result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan F Krush was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct Ordinance Violation. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan F Krush

Pre-trial conference on May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY  Pleas entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Bryan F Krush in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Bryan F Krush in court with attorney Atty Barkley appearing for Peter C. Lloyd. David Raymond Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond continued.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with Gary Bosworth or Steven Kuemmeth.
To go to the Public Defender's office today.

Defendant Bryan F Krush in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Defendant indicates he was not aware of the substantial battery charge. 
Atty Cousins makes statements.  CM matter was dismissed and refiled as this CF case. 

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.

BY THE COURT: Court will adjourn for 2 weeks to allow defendant to obtain counsel. 

Atty Cousins recommends a signature bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
